alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:25AM EST until January 10 at 11:54PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting New London and Washington Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Unionville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding is expected to spread across Meadow Road in the "Meadows" section of Farmington. Some low lying areas along Route 4 may also begin to experience flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:01 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 13.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
